Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: ArthurAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms did not resemble the web site. Room 18 door would not open had to get master key then it would not lock !! Poorly furnished with no curtains and window opposite boarded up. DO NOT STAY THERE. Hand towels only which were old and thread bare absolute disgrace that it should be on any accommodation website!! A very poor advert for Amsterdam which is a lovely city

Reviews.Title: “Rembrandtplein hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marijke P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel had good beds, breakfast was okay and it was situated in the centre, good! Still, inside the hotel a little renovation needs to ben done: painting and so on. The price was good for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “RIDICULOUS AND DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: scott w
Reviews.Content: "And here's your room..." If you went to a magic show and the magician pulled a dog turd out of his hat and said 'Hey Presto', it would describe how I felt standing in the dingy shabby room, on our first trip to Amsterdam. The decor, ugly and worn, the amenities we had been promised over the booking website (no names, but they have since given us a refund - thankyou very much for your good service, you know who you are) were not there. We had no shampoo, toilet paper, shower curtain, hairdryer, in-room safe, soap, minibar or fridge of any kind, and we had to ask for towels at reception. We were generously offered as many handtowels as we wanted...yeah, handtowels. The room had random mirrors slapped up all over the place including two on the ceiling, and a framed picture literally the size of my hand, why even bother? The room had mold on the carpet as well as some sort of stain like chemicals had melted the pile. Mold also on the bathroom ceiling, and dust on the curtains. The wiring was exposed on the phone only power socket, and the only other way to get any electricity was to risk the grimy multiplug that was running the tv. The TV was a 14 inch CRT, with terrible reception on every channel, and no remote so we couldnt adjust the volume or try and retune it ourselves. The bathroom...imagine someone was putting in the shower and his mates brought up the toilet and sink, gave them to him and he installed them inside the shower stall. You dont need to imagine it, just stay in room 4 and see for yourself. If you want to use either the sink, or the toilet you need to stand to the side, neither one can be used from the front without some sort of gymnastic endeavour. So if youre a man, your options are to climb over the toilet and stand in the shower, or stand outside the bathroom, and fire into it hoping to strike the target. Ladies have the benefit of being able to brush their teeth at the same time they use the toilet, as the handbasin is literally jutting out over the knees as you sit. The door closes with no room to stand next to the toilet unless you climb over it to get into the bathroom. Theres no shower curtain, so at least the toilet gets a clean while you shower, as long as you dont mind standing in whatever is washing off it at the same time you are trying to get clean!! Then you can try not to break your leg as you clamber over the wet porcelain and back out of the bathroom. Others have mentioned in their reveiws of chemical smells and my girlfriend got so sick during the night from this, we nearly called an ambulance...this Scummy dive poisoned her! It was so cold we had to wear our clothes, there was no heating at all, and during the day the room was cooking because the window didnt open...marvellous. There are people on here saying you get what you pay for...thats just not the case here, you do not get a safe clean hotel room, you get a run down craphole with a door that barely locks, up flights of narrow stairs past piles of laundry that did not move the entire time we were there. You get signs of the giftshop that used to be in the foyer, but no giftshop. You get a breakfast you dont want to eat because it is prisonfood, actually no, prisoners are quite well fed from what I hear. We were offered bread and a toaster to D.I.Y. and a warming tray, with some scrambled eggs in one of three trays inside, the other two trays were missing, so I didnt even get to see how bad the rest of it would have been. The other positive reveiws would suggest this hotel is worthy of four or five stars??? So this place is equivalnt to the Dorchester, equivalent to Vegas's finest? This place that has cellotape holding the wallpaper onto the main staircase is rival to the Beverly hills Hilton?? NO it blimmen isnt, it is Ridiculous and disgusting, a fraud and a health risk, a shame and a disgrace and judging by these reveiws it has been that way since at least 2005. DO NOT, EVER, consider staying here, pay a bit more if you have to, but at least your holiday will not be ruined by staying in this joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid this dump.”
Reviews.Author: TrippyTwoTrip
Reviews.Content: This was booked for me and I didn't have a choice. You do. Please listen to the bad reviews. I cannot describe how bad this place is better than previous reviewers. This is not a 2 vs 5 star thing. I have stopped in hotels & BB's for 30 years all over the world. This is the worst ever, and I have stopped in some dumps. The neglect is long term. There is a picture of a toilet , on here, that has a hole in the cistern where you pull a cable tie to flush, that was in 2009. It's still the same, and that was in the best room I saw. Imagine the other 3 rooms I saw before that were worse. I am still showering at home to feel clean again. Some of the hotels in Amsterdam can be described as shabby, that's what you get for 2 star here. But these are better ones for this hotel. SLUM. DUMP. DISGUSTING. FILTHY. DANGEROUS.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't go there”
Reviews.Author: smferguson678
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we wanted a central location at a reasonable price, and on these counts the hotel matched up to expectations. We were not looking for five-star luxury, and the inclusive breakfast (although meagre) was a bonus. But we did expect to find a clean, comfortable, refurbished room (as advertised) with a restaurant and bar (as advertised), lights which worked, and the promised toiletries, minibar and hairdryer in the room would have been a plus. We should have been prepared when we booked in and the receptionist told us that our towels would be available the following morning .... I can only guess that we had a room usually designated for casual staff and late-night drunks. It was so bad, we laughed - had no choice, really, as there were no other rooms free and the manager/owner was never 'available'. I could write my name in the dust on the windowsill, we failed to get any loo paper out of the locked dispenser, we froze in the unheated bath/shower room and separate toilet (ventilation was an uncovered hole in the wall leading to the outside). This room simply should not have been let - and it's not just that it needed refurbishment. All the public areas we saw were well in need of a good clean and redecoration, the linen was threadbare, and the hotel 'amenities' as advertised on the website simply were not there. There really is no excuse for a hotel in a city like Amsterdam to provide this quality of accommodation. It's nothing to do with 'value for money' as the cheapest backpacker hostels are better than this. It's all about cynically ripping off tourists who are unable to do anything about it once they arrive in town. Don't reward this hotelier by putting more money in his pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Value = you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideWebster
Reviews.Content: To all those detractors of this place I would say 'get over it'. This is a 2-3 star hotel at a 2-3 star price and you get what you pay for. Staff are friendly, breakfast is adequate. Location is excellent, nice quiet backwater but walkable to everywhere you would want to go. Taxi from the station is pricey as a) you will get ripped off b) the one-way system makes it a bit of a circular tour. In summary, as many have said, it really depends on the room. If you get something really crap, complain and ask to be moved. Room 10 is fine, for example. Remember, you ain't paying for the Ritz, or the view, or for the boutique ambiance. I would recommend this place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you're lucky enough to get a nice room at the front, this hotel is ok.”
Reviews.Author: yummy_parfait
Reviews.Content: We had booked through a friend who was a friend of the owner and there was a mix up with our booking. We were there 3 nights and had to move to a different room each night. The first night was awful - the room was small and dark with awful stripey wallpaper and half the window was boarded up. The second room we stayed in was nice - 2 double beds, lots of light, with a good view from the windows and a decent bathroom. The third room was ok, one double bed, small shower but there were so many mirrors in the room, I kept thinking someone was behing them spying on us! There were even 2 mirrors on the ceiling above the bed! Breakfast was ok, not great - sliced cheese and toast, coffee and juice. But it's nicer to go to a traditional cafe for food anyway. This hotel was ok for us as we weren't in the room that much and it was cheap and central. But if you're planning a trip to Amsterdam and can afford to stay somewhere better, I would.

Reviews.Title: “very well run reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pooroldpom
Reviews.Content: traveling with grandchildren we found that this hotel was clean well staffed and had very good contact with patrons.well placed for shopping and food outlets.and the views from the hotel over the canals was stunning .only problem we found was the large amount of steps to enter the hotel foyer otherwise enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Do not EVER book a room at this hotel. They sell rooms to the wholesalers as a hedge to remain full, however if someone else shows up and is willing to pay a higher price with them directly, they will sell them the room THAT YOU HAVE ALREADY PAID FOR out from under you and you will have no room. The hotel manager might offer you "for free" a room that they have in the basement as compensation. I agreed to see it just for fun and it makes a prison cell look like a Ritz-Carlton. It had a mattress on the floor, no windows, no toilet, and smelled like ammonia. They would have had to pay me 500 euros a night to spend one night in this room. This happened to me in September 2011. I had a room PAID FOR for 2 nights. I show up at 10:30 AM and they tell me that my room is not available yet but will be at 2:30. Fine. I go and do some sightseeing and return the Rembrantplein "Hotel" at about 3:00. The operator tells me that he has some bad news for me, that the hotel is "overbooked" and they do not have a room for me (despite the fact that I bought and paid for this room 3 months earlier). I would not be surprised if the online booking companies become very tired of processing refunds to their customers because of this atrocious little 20-room ripoff property and stop offering it as a legitimate online option in Amsterdam. The one good thing is that, after screwing you, they might give you a few euros for a taxi to get back to the Centraal train station to get the hell out of Amsterdam in time to get a decent room somewhere else (like Brussels, which is where I went). In my opinion, the guy that runs this little hovel is a crook. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dirty, mould on the ceiling and walls. Bad smell throughout out the hotel especially bathroom which is the basic of the basic and dirty!! Rat traps on the floors and holes in the wall fixed by cellotape! You would be better in hostel then stay in this terrible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I have ever stayed in EVER”
Reviews.Author: GazznShazz
Reviews.Content: Warning! Do not stay in this hotel! The room was the most disgusting place I have ever had the misfortune to stay in! We got into our room and first thing we noticed was the smell. We went to use the bathroom and were greeted with a nice suprise in toilet. You could wash your hands in the filthy sink whilst sitting on the toilet. The shower was so blocked and built up that when it was on it either sprayed out on all angles or it trickled out. The rest of the room was no better. The tv was hanging onto the bracket by a thread- the remote was steel cabled to the bedside but didn't work. The lamps had been attached back to the wall with masking tape and the bed was filthy with hair and cigarette burns everywhere. We also didn't appreciate the two mirrors on the ceiling! They were only 2 of about 10 used to try and make the room look bigger! The windows didn't shut properly either. Breakfast was a thoroughly sad affair, the choice was pitiful and not worth the money you pay. This hotel made us feel so terrible I can safely say it ruined Amsterdam for us as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: natalie472
Reviews.Content: Where to start.... When we walked in it was dark and dirty although the staff on the desk semed quite helpful. Our room was tatty, the wallpaper was ripped, it was dark and the lock on the door wasn't overly secure. There was no hair dryer as advertised and when i asked at the main desk the guy was quite rude about it. (not the end of the world but why advertise if you dont have the facilities?) Breakfast was poor, overall the whole place was dirty and was not what the hotel advertises! keep away!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: erzu
Reviews.Content: No hairdryer, no minibar, as said!! No towels, if you dont ask for them! Beds no good and sheets also, holes, dirty... Poor condition, windows broken etc. But frendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: gemzy88
Reviews.Content: Got there at 11pm an had no problems finding the place. Looked OK when we 1st got there. We had booked 2 rooms as there was 5 of us, we were told we were on the 5th floor and the 2nd floor. There was no lift and the stairs were very narrow and steep. When we got up to the room on the 5th floor we couldn't believe the room. It was dirty and looked like the 2nd double bed had just been thrown in there. There was 2 plug sockets in which one was hanging out of the wall. the smoke alarm had been covered so would have been no use in any occasion. There was a small balcony in the room which was handy as the room was really warm but there was a plank of wood with sharp nails sticking out of it. The bathroom was dirty. When we went to the room on the 2nd floor it looked alot cleaner but the heat was unbearable. The only good thing about the hotel was that the staff were friendly, it was in a brilliant location and the breakfast was ok. Definitely wouldn't stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved and cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: pod73
Reviews.Content: I nearly cancelled cause of all the bad reviews glad i didnt had brilliant time. The staff all very friendly and hotel in great location. The only bad thing about hotel coudnt seem to get a coffee in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly awful not fit for a dog!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dawnee58
Reviews.Content: This place was disgusting! We should have realised as soon as we sat in the bar area waiting for our room! The cushions were worn, dirty and ripped. The surround of the sink in the toilet in the bar area was caving in with wet and was really smelly. We are not posh people and are quite used to down market hotels as long as the room is clean, IT WAS FAR FROM EVEN CLOSE TO CLEAN. The banister was filthy and worn, the fire alarm was covered in filth, the paint work was flaking and dirty. The room was smelly, paper peeling and filth all around the foors. Net curtains were stained and torn, the "double" bed was two stained single mattresses, topped with stained sheets. The repairs in the bathroom were filthy as was the woodwork, and all kinds of rubbish was thrown outside our window. The toilet seat was also broken. We complained straight away only to be told that the smell came from the canal!! Funny considering that there was no smell outside beside the water. I would advise that no one stays here it really was the worst place ever! The pictures on the website are in no way representative of our experience, dont even think of staying here, we left without staying and lost our money as it was taken at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, horrible room”
Reviews.Author: allneonlike
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent - right by a canal, you can easily walk to many of Amsterdam's best sights. As said in many of the other reviews, the lobby (and the bar) are great, and give you a false idea of how unpleasant the rooms are. Although I did not have a problem with the cleanliness, the room was freezing - there was no heating whatsoever. The walls were paper thin too, so light sleepers should seek elsewhere. The staff seemed a bit clueless - they tried to charge me twice, and were quite rude until they looked through their records at my insistence - they were then apologetic. Plus points apart from location are shower (very hot for all my time there) and the breakfast, though unexciting, was perfectly fine. Cleaning staff did a good job as far as I am concerned. But even at the relatively cheap price I would recommend you steer clear unless you can tolerate very cold and depressing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unacceptable hotel - don't even think of staying there!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mailaki
Reviews.Content: This hotel was TERRIBLE!!! We booked this hotel for four nights during our stay in Amsterdam. The room was dirty, there were no towels in the bathroom, the central heating was not working and the temperature in Amsterdam was below 0 degrees, there was no warm water in the bathroom and the TV had no reception. There was a piece of wooden board instead of a window and as there was moist on the ceiling they had placed a blanket there so that no water ran from the ceiling. It looked rather nice on the website but the reality was very different. Don't even think of staying there NEVER!!! The noise through the thin walls won't let you sleep and you will feel disgust to take a bath. STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: JR9584
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT REMBRANTPLEIN! The rooms pictured on their website are not of the actual hotel! The rooms and bathrooms are tiny and they stink! The staff are completely incompetent. We were kept waiting for over twenty minutes while the guy tried to figure out how to work the computer system â€“ he didnâ€™t even know how to check us in! When we were finally given the key, we had to haul our own luggage up the 6 narrow flights of stairs, only to discover that the room we had been given was not the room we had booked. We booked a twin and were given a single. When we went back down the stairs to complain we were told â€œwhat do you expect â€“ itâ€™s a two star hotelâ€�!!! THE STAFF ARE THE RUDEST PEOPLE I HAVE EVER MET! I tried to reason with the incompetent guy at the front desk â€“ but when he refused to give us the room we had booked and refused to give us a refund, I asked that he get the manager on the phone for me to speak to. The manager was even worse than the first guy and verbally abused and swore at me over the phone. I would rather sleep on the street than stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: imacaulay
Reviews.Content: Dreadful hotel, and wouldn't recommend it to an enemy. Our room was no. 8 on the 3rd floor, and was tiny and dirty. The bathroom was cramped; while sitting on the toilet you could have easily washed your hands in the sink on your lap, and washed your hair in the "shower". Bearing in mind that we travelled in November, and the weather was cold and wet, we were supplied with a sheet (which was a single on the double bed) and what can only be described as an offcut from the curtains, to sleep under. The pillows were extremely lumpy, and when we asked reception for another for the following night, we were told that we couldn't as they had no spares, and were offered towels instead! The website offered cable TV in rooms, but couldn't understand why ours wouldn't work; when we asked for some help at reception, we were told by the very honest man, that none of the televisions worked in the building, as the owner had not paid the cable bill!!!! The last straw, which prompted us to leave, 2 nights early, was the visitor we had in the night which persistantly ate our food which was in the room, lending to our 2nd night without sleep. After looking for any entry holes, we found a very 'lived in' mouse hole going down into the floorboards. The only up-side is the location, but not even that could liften our spirits after experiencing what we did in this grotty, dsgusting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there - Rembrandtplein Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evelaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel condition is in need of a desperate upgrade/cleanup. It was in such a disgusting condition that we were so disappointed when we checkin. The hotel website photos feature is nothing close to what you would expect. Its probably the only 2 rooms that is in the condition as feature on the website the rest of the 18rooms are simply horrible. Walking towards the hotel and lobby doesnâ€™t see so bad, but as soon as you proceed up to the rooms, you have to climb a few flights of extremely steep and narrow stairs. Small dingy room, dusty and the bed seems like it has been infected with all kind of bugs. The bathroom and toilet is nowhere any better, grubby wall tiles separate by a dirty shower curtain. The view from the window was to a shaft. In the bottom of the shaft there was lots of garbage and we had 2 raining nights and the rain was falling on the rubbish/cans making so much noise that kept my partner awake most of the night. The only positive aspect is probably the location. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: FrankandJane_30
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice staff... but an absolute dump. This place hasn't seen maintenance in decades. Paint is peeling, wallpaper is torn and tattered, carpet is worn, torn patched and damp. The ceiling in our shower was falling apart and leaking water, the bathroom stunk the bed covering was worn and stained. We're seasoned travelers who know what to expect in European hotels, so we aren't fussy; but this place made us cringe. It is by far the worst we've encountered. Unless you're a inebriated couple of guys who's only option is sleeping on the bench across the canal, we suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was terrible”
Reviews.Author: leehannah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. The room and toilet stank of stale urine!! We waited hours on towels and didn't get any fresh over the weekend. The 24 hour bar had 2 can of lager on the first night. The bed had springs sticking out the matress. The first night we thought a porn movie was being made in the next room as the noise was terrible as walls paper thin. And to top it all the door wouldn't lock and they could not move us. My partner eventually managed to agree a free bar but only after he was refused his money back. Only good think was location was close to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Resonable basic hotel, but beware the basement!”
Reviews.Author: mike21683
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't nearly as bad as the reviews would make out! It is a perfectly fine basic hotel. The location is fantastic, you can walk everywhere within 10 minutes. The staff were friendly, and the rooms had adequate bathroom facilities. If you just want somewhere to sleep, and aren't expecting 5* luxury, then this place is fine, especially for the price which is good. HOWEVER - I must say that when we arrived, the guy on the desk told us that due to overbooking on the automatic bookings system they use, that even though there were 4 of us they only had one 2 person room available. They offered us a basement room for the other 2. We looked at it and it was just a mattress on the ground, with no windows or even bathroom facilities. We asked instead for them to put bedding on the floor of the 2 person room, and we would cram into that room for the night (the next 3 nights we were moved to a 4 person room). This was quite annoying, and they did give us a discount for the inconvenience, but had it just been 2 of us with no alternative, we would have had to possibly sleep in the horrible basement! I asked the guy on the desk if it happened very often, and he said "all the time" and it was a "major problem". I have seen others mention the basement on here, so I would recommend contacting the hotel directly to make a booking - not through a 3rd party, to ensure this doesn't happen to you!

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque on the outside, dissapointing on the inside!”
Reviews.Author: bibs74
Reviews.Content: On first arrival to the Rembrandtplein Hotel in Amsterdam, you wlk up a lovely cobbled street with bridges over the canal to either side. The first appearance of the hotel looked lovely and welcoming and you flet pleased with your choice. On reception we were greeted by the owner who seemed nice enough and he gave us our keys and pointed us towards the stairs and said we were in room 14. This is where the nice part of the experience ended for us. What he didn't tell you whilst carrying a heavy bag was that room 14 was infact on the 5th floor of a 6 story hotel and that the stairs were steep and winding so making it more difficult to get up with lugguage etc. When we finally arrived on the 5th floor the arrowpointing towards our room was drawn on in marker as the arrow was missing so we made our way to the room. Once in the room I could not belive I had paid the money I did for it as there was peeling wall paper, no tolietries in the extremely small bathroom (the toilet was near enough in the shower and was only divided by a curtain), the carpet ran up the side of what I can only describe as a box with a mattress on top, and the carpet did not reach to the side of the room under the radiator, the carpet was filthy and heavily stained and looked like it hadn't been vacced in years let alone months, and there was a layer of mold on the bathroom door as there was no extractor fan for the steam. There was an electrical wire sticking out where i assume it once was. This hotel was only 100 yards from the Raddison and was very close to the main part of town yet they were literally worlds apart. This hotel was awarded a 2 star yet I would say it wasn't worthy of that, I have stayed in better B & B's in Blackpool and thats saying something. I wouldn't advise this hotel to anyone who likes cleanliness as that it did not have in any shape of form. However there were a couple of plus's to this. The night receptionist was friendly and welcoming and always happy to help when you returned from your trips/nights out, the continental breakfast was simple but adequate and there were maps and leaflets on things to do and how to get about in the reception area which did help. The moral of this is to stay out of this hotel as much as possible to avoid the horrendous stair climbing and the room in general or get drunk and try and forget where you are staying. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, helpful staff, will definitely be staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: deeeevo_13
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam in late January with my girlfriend and stayed at this hotel after finding it on lastminute.com for a much cheaper price than many of the hostels were charging. It wasn't anything overly special, but we weren't in Amsterdam to spend all day and night in the hotel. The staff were friendly and were more than happy to swap our rooms around for a family sized room for no extra charge (we wanted a room with a view of the canal out the front!) The room was pretty basic, but it had clean sheets, television and a decent shower. Everything you needed for a decent nights sleep. The bar downstairs was open 24hrs so there was always someone on hand to help if we needed anything. It was a bit annoying that you had to hand in your keys every time you went outside, made ducking out for a quick smoke a bit tedious. If you're after a luxurious hotel don't go here, but if you're after a clean basic room and friendly staff i would recommend it without hesitation. I think the negative reviews on here are from people who were expecting a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: holidaypairWiltshire
Reviews.Content: On arrival first impressions were good until we were given the room key, we had to make our way up some very narrow stairs, carrying suitcases was to say the least perilous, the room was tiny and in a very sad state of repair. the wallpaper had senn better days, the bedside lights were out of reach and the lampshade on one was taped up with masking tap to hold it together. the toilet come shower room was beyond belief. the towels supplied were hand towels, the shower was partly blocked and was not suficient to shower properly. there was advertised a mini bar in each room also tea/coffee making facilitys we had neither, the bar only had one type of beer that was canned, there was no food available, on our first evening we returned to the hotel for a drink before going to bed and the highlight of that evening was watching the staff on a lap top looking at perfume sitting at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you want to just crash out”
Reviews.Author: NRW75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok if you dont expect much. The room came with a tv that kept cutting out, a live wire coming out of the wall and no hairdryer, mini bar or safe. But to be honest, it is worth the money. Cheap nice-ish looking hotel, great location, fairly nice staff, and fairly clean. The main thing i would recommend the hotel to improve, would be the bar. One half bottle of whisky and no beer or any form of alcohol in stock is not particularly what id call a bar. Didnt try the breakfast in the mornings, but the breakfast area didnt look too bad, think it needed abit of a facelift though. And one last thing is the bell tower down the canal. Stayed for 5days, and 4 days of them it was going off constantly for about 20 minutes, but you do EVENTUALLY get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown,sleazey and they will steal your clothes while you're out”
Reviews.Author: armlessneil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights,initially on 5th floor at the top of a series of difficult and steep stairs-room 21 from which clothing was stolen by someone who had access via a key.When confronted some remorse expressed but the best we got was an"upgrade" to a room on a lower floor which at least had a view of the canal.Definitely does not live up to the impression created by website.Go elswhere!

Reviews.Title: “Digusting hotel out to steal your money”
Reviews.Author: tabs1981
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms look like you are likely to get some sort of infection from them. Our room was extremely hot and when we asked for a fan they gave us one with no cover (great health and safety there). They took too much money from our accounts and have refused to give it back as they need to talk to the hotel manager who doesnt exist. Worst hotel not just in Europe but worst I have seen in the world. Very very dodgy staff and should be closed. Absolutely vile and disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware! Do not EVER stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Homla
Reviews.Content: The people who work there has no interest at all to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is near by a church witch rings every 15minutes beetween 06 am- 11pm but the stuff claims that they have NEVER heard the bells. They wonÂ´t give you the phone number to the hotel manager, cause they say that they donÂ´t even know who the manager is... so to speak clear, they are a unreliable hotel!!!!! So, they took our money although we didnÂ´t stay there because of the bells! The stuff told us that it was OK to not pay because of that. The next they the stuff says that they never heard about that and that we should pay!! Now one month later took they 230 $ from my bank account! VERY UNHONEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! WORST EXPERIENCE IN MY LIFE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst. hotel. ever.”
Reviews.Author: dsands01
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in Amsterdam. It's run by greedy russians who do nothing but trick and scam you to get money. Avoid this hotel at every cost. Looks pretty good - but tastes aweful and could potentially ruin your vacation, as it did ours.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, although wouldn't stay there again!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Forfar63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good base for seeing Amsterdam, Rembrandtplein & Dam square & red light district all very close by. The hotel is very tired and somewhat sleazy with some rooms coming (pardon the pun) with mirrored ceilings and every available wall is mirrored. Hotel details do state hair dryers in the rooms but we were told that that was only for the advert, although they did managed to find us one. Our room was on the fourth floor and all staircases are extremly steep and dodgy to tackle whilst under the influence of the local brew. One of the windows in our room was boarded up, no shower curtain and no soap in the bathroom but the bed was comfy. The staff were friendly and if you're on an budget and want an ensuite you'll be ok. Just don't inhale as you walk up by the 3rd floor, strong smell of the other local produce.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dodgy decor but friendly, clean and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SugarplumMonkey
Reviews.Content: I took my mum on a week-long trip to Amsterdam last week and chose this place to stay because it was affordable without being clearly aimed at the smoking tourist croud. The room was very dark with an incredible choice and combination of curtains / bedspread / wallpaper (certainly raises a smile if you have a sense of humour!) and it would probably get quite depressing if you spent a particularly long time in it. However, other than to sleep and shower we spent very minimal time in the room. The fact that it was centrally located, being within easy walking distance of all districts and that it was comfrtable, clean and quiet meant that it served us perfectly. If you are used to luxury or can't cope with a couple of flights of steep stairs it's probably not for you but if you just want somewhere to get a good nights sleep and don't have too much regard for interior design, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Biohazard 25”
Reviews.Author: DeezNutts
Reviews.Content: STRAIGHT UP THIS WAS THE WORST HOTEL EVER!!!! I had a minor back injury which led to me arriving at the hotel a tiny bit late. She had already givin our room to another customer which then left us roomless. We were then told we could go to the spare room which is located in the basement. This room is known as room 25. I do not suggest taking this spare room because it smells so foul that you would think someone was murdered and left for death in there. Not to mention we could hear the mice crawling in the walls. It is also 50 degrees Celsus in tehre because of a heater that runs the building. It is so musky in there it releases a very distrubing smell that will follow you and your luggage for the rest of your trip. Also when we were outside smoking we notcied 3 dead rats. NOT MICE PEOPLE, RATS. I would not suggest this even to your worst enemy. This place should be shut down or condemned

Reviews.Title: “A Dump - Stay far Away”
Reviews.Author: Katherine67
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of October 2008 with my family and it is an experience never to be repeated. The hotel is in an advanced state of disrepair and is not clean. The carpet in the communal areas is very poorly fitted and given how steep and narrow the stairs are (there is no elevator) I would not be surprised if there is an accident. The rooms are even worse. Curtains are torn and dirty, the tiles in the bathroom are coming out of the wall, the sanitaryware is very old, chipped and stained and sheets and towels are threadbare. My sister in law asked to borrow a hairdryer - there is only one at reception and someone else was using it - so she had to do without. One hairdryer for an entire hotel!! The breakfast is disgusting and they do not tell you that you it is not included in the price until you have exited the equally dialpidated bar area where they serve it and at Euro 7, 50 you are being ripped off for your further displeasure. I posted a review on Venere which is the website I booked it on and I ahve yet to see it posted. It causes me to wonder if this agent is filtering reviews because when we booked with Venere there were very few review and no recent or negative ones. I should have been suspicious! This hotel has serious heath and safety issues and should not be operating.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: AnneW1982
Reviews.Content: Good and bad points - Good - 5 minutes walk away from Red Light District and Dam Square. Bad - There is no lift, we stayed in Room 19 which was at the very top of the hotel, which is about 8 flights of stairs up. It was an absolute disaster trying to get up and down them, especially with luggage. Carpet in hotel not the cleanest, they sting you for city tax and credit card charges so be prepared and there is a church at the top of the street which bell rings constantly. Its very annoying. Advice - only go here if you are well and able to walk up stairs!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kenzie01
Reviews.Content: close to amenities, but nice and quiet on an evening. could do with a good clean and a lick of paint. rooms very basic but hey your only sleeping in them. if you have problems with stairs this is not the hotel for you. staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nicp24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated on a lovely little street that was close enough to all the hussle an bustle but far enough away so that it was quiet and felt safe at night, dam square was only a 10 minute walk away and central station was 20minutes on foot. The rooms were dated in there decor, but were very clean although small they had eveything to offer. I would definatley recommend and stay there again, we had clean towels everyday and the rooms were cleaned daily. The staff that worked there were very friendly and helpful the reception was open 24 - 7 so it didnt matter what time you came an went .

Reviews.Title: “Holiday with friends”
Reviews.Author: Terezacharlie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated at great place in quiet street and right in center, so its close to Rembrandplein square, chinese part, flowers market and red light zone. You can walk easily to centraal station. So you get easily and fast everywhere in center. People who worked there were friendly, we had no problem. Reception is open 24h, so no problem with comming back late at night. We had room for 4 people and had view on the street. The room was clean and simple. Other rooms which have windows on the other side of the house, have no view. You can see just another wall from the window and theres almost no light thanks to that. Otherwise we were content and we enjoyed our stay over there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst.”
Reviews.Author: YorkTom
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on this hotel before booking and as there was a mixed bag, thought I'd give it a try. However my friend and I asked to leave after the first night it was that bad. Ant powder on the floor, no window - just a boarded up frame, shower that was like a tap, a plug with no surround just exposed wires, and stains and crumbs on the floor. I would recommend you avoid this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel excellent”
Reviews.Author: mimiWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful we stayed for two nights but would defintely stay here again as it was a pleasant atmospheric hotel and the staff were friendly helpful and breakfast was lovely. We would recommend this hotel for its location and proximity to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller077
Reviews.Content: This was a surprisingly nice place for a "hostel". It was a perfect location to walk to all of the tourist locales. The first impression upon entering the hotel was very positive. The staircases were strange, but that goes with an old house in amsterdam, and to top it off we were in the room at the VERY top. The bathrooms and beds were VERY clean. Access to rooms was given only to guests through a "buzz-in" process. Great overall experience. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice pension”
Reviews.Author: Nipssa
Reviews.Content: I found Rembrandplein to be a simple, friendly and clean pension. Sheets and linen, bath, were impeccably clean, as you would expect in the Netherlands. I saw nothing that could prompt some of the complaints I've seen here. Service was fine. The stairs are steep... it's a building from the 1600s. I am an American who's lived many years in Europe. Let me say emphatically, this is NOT a place for Americans used to Hiltons. If that is what you want., don't come to Europe. Or stay at the Hilton. But don't stay here and give it bad marks just because you didn't have cable and an ice machine. I'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during a layover in Amsterdam. I have travelled a fair amount and have stayed at a range of hotels from luxury properties to hostels in my younger years. Never have I stayed in a hotel as filthy as the Rembrandtplein. Granted, the location is extremely convenient to all the sites of Amsterdam and is situated in a pretty canal with beautiful church bells ringing in the distance. However, I would never stay here again and strongly recommend others to stay away as well. We were travelling as a group of four and had originally requested two twin rooms. Upon arrival, we were given room 7 and our companions a room on the 3rd floor. Immediately upon leaving the reception it was clear that this hotel is in dire need of refurbishment. The condition of this hotel cannot be described as charming outside of it's architectural gems such as the breakfast room ceiling and steep staircase. Our friends requested another room immediately and after a second request were given room 18 which was larger and appeared to be somewhat cleaner than their original room. Our room looked over an internal courtyard - more like an air shaft. The ground was littered with various garbage including cigarette butts and unused tiles. Upon entering the room we were immediately shocked by the obvious filth in which we were staying. The bedspreads were stained and had cigarette burns, the carpet was equally stained and the ceiling was grey with dirt. Perhaps it was a blessing that half of the lighting was inoperable as it would have certainly revealed more of the room's dirt. The bathroom was even worse, the tub surround and ceiling covered in black mould. The tub itself was relatively clean but the ledge had obviously not been cleaned for some time. We finally took a shower our last day before departing for home and made the mistake of using the shower curtain to prevent water from splashing onto the small floor. Once the hot water and steam from the shower came into contact with the curtain I nearly gagged from the stench that arose. It was a mixture of urine and such dirt that the smell permeated the entire bathroom and even our room. The neighbouring room was occupied by a number of males and the marijuana smoke was so thick in the hallway it entered our room as well. The only thing that appeared to be clean were the sheets - we did not unpack and tried not to touch any of the other surfaces at all. Reception indicated that they clean daily and thoroughly but this is not the case at all - the lamp bases were obviously filthy and the wardrobe dusty as well. Breakfast was average at best. Orange juice, coffee and tea were accompanied by scrambled eggs (ok) and the saltiest most fat riddled bacon I have ever eaten. There was ham and cheese however, the cheese slices were obviously dried out indicating they were sitting there for a long time. Reception was friendly enough however, we asked for wake up calls both mornings and never received them. We ordered a taxi for the morning of departure and it was not ordered until we reminded them again and a call was made. This hotel was definitely not worth the 75 Euro we paid per night. Due to the fact that we were staying only two nights we did not want the hassle of finding other accommodation but I would never stay again - not even for one night. Stay far far away from this hotel - it is not worth your money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Danimal2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Hotel is small and old, but the location is perfect. Located on a quiet canal, is only a couple minute walk to coffee shops and all the action the red light district has to offer. There is no elevator, so don't stay on the fifth floor. Breakfast consisted of bacon, eggs, and toast.

Reviews.Title: “pleased.”
Reviews.Author: pete070
Reviews.Content: A quirky little hotel in a great location.We only stayed 2 nights and it was a cosy sort of place with cable tv.DON'T expect some sort of palace because the rooms are very small,you get what you pay for.The rooms were clean and I liked the sleazy mirrors on the ceiling too.I would reccomend this hotel for 1 or 2 nights but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in lovely area for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Maz52
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews (mostly poor) after we had made the booking, so it was with some intrepidation that we entered the hotel! We feel that we can sympathise with many of the comments. The hotel is in a lovely position for exploring Amsterdam - the canalled road prettily framed by the church at the end. The hotel, inside and out, looked like it was once quite splendid BUT it now looks tired, worn & in need of a face lift. The carpets are quite threadbare, furniture worn - in some places broken, and bathroom fittings in need of replacement. We travelled as a party of 4 adults, staying 3 nights. The rooms (no.s 8&9) we were given on our 1st night were unacceptable... as well as being quite shabby, they were very small, no tables or drawers for storage and a tiny shower room/toilet (a multitude of mirrors however!) The two female staff on reception were sympathetic and most helpful, moving us to alternative rooms (usually reserved for 4 persons) for our 2nd & 3rd nights (Room no.s 1 & 11 ).These rooms were very much better- more room & better facilities! In both rooms, the sheets were spotlessly clean as were the towels. The breakfasts were fine...cereals, toast,cold meats and cheese, bacon & scrambled eggs! Would we recommend it? At Â£80 per room per night, no, not to other couples who are looking for reasonable accomadation in that price range - unless they can be assured they would have the larger 4 bedded rooms. Stag parties, sharing the cost of the larger room, would think they had a good deal! All in all, this hotel did not spoil our stay in Amsterdam....we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves in this lively city!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel ever”
Reviews.Author: roamer101
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a hostelbookers website, with no booking fee. I booked it becasue i have no fear of going cheap and cheerful, and I have stayed in some pretty horrible places on my budget travels. Worst case scenario, i had to wear flip-flops in the shower, nothing too bad there. On arrival the booking fee of 3% was due plus an 8% charge for tourist tax in Amsterdam (this was the first i'd heard to these taxes as the website i had used when boking expressly stated that there was no booking fee). Then the bathroom stank of bleach so much that i gagged when i tried to pee. There was no toilet paper supplied and i had to insist that the reception staff give me toilet paper, while they repeated over and over that the cleaner had left some in the room if i cared to look. The location, while good isn't great. Leidesplein is a much nicer friendly area with a lot more life and much more to do around the area. The pillow cases had blood stains. The towels weren't replaced by clean ones during their "room clean", nor was the bed made. The top blanket was pulled up over everything. So when we pulled back the blanket the bed was still a mess. What i didn;t understand was why bother? Why bother pulling the blanket up on the bed when they aren't going to make it or replace the towels? That made me very uncomfortable, these people had been in our room with our possessions and hadn't even cleaned up... Very Weird! DO NOT STAY HERE, if you are really really desperate (now really desperate, and willing to pay more than the quoted price) and you have no where else to go, then please DO NOT leave any valuables around. These people are unhelpful, unfriendly, unappproachable and sneaky. Oh, and make sure you bring somrthing to stand on in the shower because it is disgusting. Plus side: the water pressure in the shower was good and the TV worked. And the mirrors do make the place look cleaner than you think. Each morning we were woken by church bells, if that's your thing.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this through A1 Discount Hotels on the net. The hotel is in a great position overlooking a canal and is only a short walk to all the shops and attractions of Amsterdam. The hotel itself is a bit on the tatty side and would benefit from a redecorate, but apart from that the room was clean and of a good size (room 1). It was nice and quiet, no rowdy drunks or anything like that as I had my doubts initially as I had seen reference to the hotel in Stagbookers. The staff were friendly and helpfull despite other reports I have seen regarding this hotel. We paid Â£55 per night for the room with breakfast. The breakfast was OK with eggs, cheese, ham and toast available with juices and coffee or tea and was available from 8AM to 11AM which was good if you had a night on the town and did not want to get up too early. All in all not bad for the money but don't expect luxury for the price you pay. I have stayed in better but then again I have stopped in worse for the same money and more.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Quirky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was my first trip to Amsterdam. There were many things I let slide because I thought that perhaps I was being snobby my first time in this foreign country. I said to myself "Wow, they don't even give you towels in the room around here! And look at how tiny the room is; I can't even stand up without banging my head on the eaves." I shouldn't have to ask for towels like it's a privilege. The hotel has a quirky feel, like it was renovated from some other use. Steep, crooked stairs that give the place a very old school feel. The bathroom is literally a toilet, a shower head and a drain in the middle of the floor, and I was even OK with that. The neighborhood is quiet but very centrally located. Location is the best feature of the hotel. Overall, I was able to adapt to everything since I had the bare necessities. But I couldn't imagine trying to convice my girlfriend to stay in a place like that. Couples planning to spend quality time in the room should know this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “What - no rooms at the inn !!”
Reviews.Author: Dena004
Reviews.Content: A party of 14 arrived to enjoy a birthday weekend of 3 nights in October 05. The reservation was made with the hotel direct in January 05 and a further email was sent July 05 to remind them of the booking due to the large numbers in the party. On arrival late afternoon we were told by the receptionist that there were only 3 rooms available and for one night only. When a copy of the emailed booking was shown we were told that there were still no rooms available and we asked to speak with the manager who would not come to reception but told the tearful receptionist to sort it. Eventually she managed to find 6 rooms which we kept for the whole weekend but watched when other visitors were turned away, equally having booked rooms.One couple from our party had to find alternative accommodation elsewhere (approx. 25mins away) and we received no apology for this. When settling the bill at the end of the weekend, one of the party who had booked a single room was charged for a double (she took the double because she did not want to be somewhere else on her own and her single room was not available). The hotel was definitely a 2 star with some rooms disgustingly dirty, well worn and like prison cells in some cases. Breakfasts were very basic and cleanliness was not a priority anywhere in the hotel apart from the reception! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone and if a booking has been made I would definitely go through an agent rather than the hotel direct as at least you have some chance of a refund or alternative accommodation if (or when) they overbook which seems to be the norm here.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace for the City of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked one of the cheap rooms through Internet. About the same price as the ones I stayed in London, Paris, Luxembourg, Brussels, Bruges per person per night but far far worse. The room was a hot dirty basement room with no air flow (felt like a gas chamber for the 5 minutes I spend inside the room), at the end of a dirty long corridor where the laundry is, full of obstacles and only one exit through the corridor (in case of fire I pity the poor souls who will be trapped there). The room has a shower but for toilet one has to head to the hotel's bar toilet in the first floor. It was the worst room I have ever seen in my life. Unfortunately I had payed the room and couldn 't get a refund although I didn't use the room at all -- I moved to another hotel immediately. The staff was not helpful and the only thing they cared for is how to get the money. It is a disgrace for the city of Amsterdam. I made an official complaint although I don't know what will come out of it. Very nasty surprise for a first-time visit in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ghost Hotel and mirrors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in a small office in a corner on one of the Straats, it seemed like a romantic, relaxing and cheap getaways. The staff were mysterious and curious but friendly and surprisingly they spoke our language which is almost a dead language, we are originally from Skurks Molvania. The room was full of mirrors, not only on the sides but on the ceilings in the shape of the letter V. It seems that Rembrandtplein was a brothel before. My girlfriend spent the night finding the right spot between the cracks of the letter V. It was fairly clean and had a small TV. The hotel gives the impression of being haunted with malfunctions in the doors and reflections from all the mirrors and the 1300 feeling. The stairs are steep. The restaurant seemed to be a fancy restaurant in better years, now is a confy caffeteria for the breakfast that was not bad at all considering the price. They gave us some coupons as well for some local attractions but wanted us to charge us 50 Euros for phone calls that we never did. Very centric and close to everything, you can get drunk and find your way easily.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear!”
Reviews.Author: OneNorwegian
Reviews.Content: We are three couples who went to Amsterdam for a weekend trip in May 2005. One couple had to leave immediately to find another hotel as their room was extremely hot (no exaggeration) because the heater was on, could not be turned off and windows were impossible to open. Additionally cigarette smoke leaked from the neighboring room underneath their door. The other couple were content with their room. In our room, both two radiators were hot. I managed to shut off one but the other was totally stuck. We asked the reception several times for help but nothing happened.The first night was terrible because of the heat. On the next day we had to "discuss" quite intensely with the receptionist to change rooms but finally we got another room which turned out to be a lot better. However, returning from dinner late on the last evening, it turned out somebody had kicked in the door to our room, stealing, among others a laptop PC that I had kept hidden in my suitcase at all times. Only our room had been broken into. Did somebody know beforehand that I had my PC with me, stowed away deep down in my suitcase? I don't know... There are no safes in the rooms. It is possible to store valuables in the reception they told us - afterwards... The manager told us that two weeks ago exact the same thing had happened; the doors to three rooms had been kicked in by unknown burglars. So far he has accepted no responsibility for our loss. Is there anything positive about this hotel? Well, the sheets were clean, and the breakfast was ok, served in a calm and pleasant breakfast room. The location is central and the area is quiet with no traffic noise. It is a small hotel with 15 rooms. You might find this hotel OK if you get one of the good rooms. Do check the room before you give them your credit card details! Don't bring any valuables!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: piglet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Hoteladvice for a very good price so I wasn't expecting much and the website looked good. On arrival (early) we left our bags in the lobby (which looked ok at the time) and then came back at 2.00pm when we were told, to check in. I had reserved a double room and this had been confirmed. The room was the highest one they had, right in the attic and was a dump. There were two single beds, one six inches lower than the other, as it had had it's legs removed so it would fit under the eaves! There was a desk with tv on and a tiny wardrobe which had no means of hanging anything up. The sheets were clean but the breadspreads were covered in hairs and cigarette burns. The bathroom was a typical Dutch bathroom where the shower and tiolet are in the same cubicle but there wan't even a curtain and the toilet paper got wet when we had a shower. I had also emailed before we went and was told there was a hairdryer in the room - there was no sign of one. I rang reception to complain but there was nothing the could do until the next night because they were full. (I wish I had checked on the room when we dropped our bags off!) We were only there two nights but we did move rooms and it was slightly better. Breakfast was not great either, I have never seen brown scrambled eggs before! The moral of the story is that you get what you pay for. I paid 115e for two nights but would not pay more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Rembrandtplein Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBDVB
Reviews.Content: After a couple of emails, and a phone conversation with the Rembrandtplein Hotel, I booked a room for 5 nights in September. The staff was very nice, the service good, and the room was very sufficient. Included in the price were all taxes, and it included a basic Dutch breakfast served in their small lounge, which was a bar in the evening hours. The hotel is a canal house dating from the late 1600's I believe, and the location is terrific, with the hotel located at Groenburgwal 27. It is within three blocks of the Muntplein, where you get off the #4 Tram from Centraal Station and walk behind the Hotel de l'Europe. Cafe de Jaren is right around the corner. There's a wonderful little draw bridge at one end of the street, and framed by the bridge at the opposite end is the Zuiderkerk. The phone number is 31 20 428 4244!

HotelInfo.Name: Rembrandtplein Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Groenburgwal 27, Amsterdam 1011, The Netherlands
